If you are applying for a certificate by mail, you must send a letter stating what type of certificate you are requesting as well as the required information, identification and forms listed below.

Please make sure to include a return address.

Send copies of the following required information:

Full name at birth

Date of birth

Both parents’ full names, including mother’s maiden name

Daytime phone number

A valid driver’s license, or two of the following, one of which must have a photo:

Social Security Card

Employment ID

State or City ID

If you do not have any of the IDs listed above, please provide copies of at least two recent bills which show your name and current address.

Print and fill out the appropriate form below and mail it to Vital Record Mail Services:

» Request Certificate of Birth (English)

» Solicitud de certificado de nacimiento (español)

» Request Certificate of Birth for Adopted Person (English)

» Solicitud de certificado de nacimiento de una persona adoptada (español)

Mailing Address:

Vital Record Mail Services

ATTN: New Haven Vital Records

P.O. Box 222130

El Paso, TX 79913

Payment Information

MAIL ORDER payment options are listed on the application form. Please remember to include the full amount with Shipping & Handling for your desired mail return method.

Cash is NOT accepted for mail requests

If you are applying for a certificate by mail, you must send a letter stating what type of certificate you are requesting as well as the required information, identification and forms listed below. Please make sure to include a return address.

Send copies of the following required information:

Name of deceased

Date of death

One of the acceptable forms of identification (ID):

Current State ID issued by DMV

Current motor vehicle ID issued by the State DMV (with the correct address)

A valid passport (copy of page with photo and expiration date listed)

Current Military ID

If you do not have any of these IDs, you will need any two of the following documents:

Social Security Card

Current utility bill showing name and address

Voter’s Registration Card

Car Registration showing your name and address

Print and fill out the appropriate form below and mail it to Vital Record Mail Services:

» Request Certificate of Death (English)

» Solicitud de certificado de defunción (español)

» Request Certificate of Fetal Death (English)

» Solicitud de certificado de muerte fetal (español)

Mailing Address:

Vital Record Mail Services

ATTN: New Haven Vital Records

P.O. Box 222130

El Paso, TX 79913

Payment Information

MAIL ORDER payment options are listed on the application form. Please remember to include the full amount with Shipping & Handling for your desired mail return method.

Cash is NOT accepted for mail requests

MARRIAGE CERTIFICATES

Marriage certificates are open to the public.

Have the Required Information:

Names of the bride(s) and/or groom(s);

Bride’s maiden name;

Date of marriage

One of the acceptable forms of identification (ID):

Current State ID issued by DMV

Current motor vehicle ID issued by the State DMV (with the correct address)

A valid passport (copy of page with photo and expiration date listed)

Current Military ID

If you do not have any of these IDs, you will need any two of the following documents:

Social Security Card

Current utility bill showing name and address

Voter’s Registration Card

Car Registration showing your name and address

Print and fill out the appropriate form below and bring it with you to the Office of Vital Statistics:

» Request Certificate of Marriage (English)

» Solicitud de certificado de matrimonio (español)

» Request Certificate of Civil Union (English)

» Solicitud de certificado de unión civil (español)

» Request Conversion of Civil Union to Marriage Certificate (English)

» Solicitud de conversión de certificado de unión civil a matrimonio (español)

MARRIAGE LICENSES

Marriage licenses issued from New Haven Vital Statistics are valid only for 65 days from the date it is initially issued to those who are being wed in the city of New Haven. You must be at least 18 years of age to apply. Both parties must be present in order to apply for the license.

Have the Required Information:

Both parties must have one of the acceptable forms of identification (the IDs must include Date of Birth, Signature, and Expiration Date):

Current State ID issued by DMV

Current motor vehicle ID issued by DMV (with the correct address)

A valid passport (copy of page with photo and expiration date listed)

Current Military ID

Print and fill out the appropriate form below and bring it with you to the Office of Vital Statistics:

» Request License of Marriage (English)

» Solicitud de certificado de matrimonio (español)

A marriage license will only be issued if the entire marriage license application form is filled in. That includes the information on who the Officiator will be to perform the ceremony in New Haven.

Applications are processed Monday-Friday 9:00 AM-4:30 PM only.

Payment Information

The fee is $20.00 per marriage certificate copy and $50.00 for a marriage license

All fees for documents are payable by cash, credit, or money order. Money orders should be made payable to Vital Statistics.

We do not accept personal checks

Justices of the Peace:

A listing of Local Justices of the Peace can be provided by the Vital Statistics staff upon request.

Vital Statistics office will not provide a Justice of the Peace to perform a marriage in City Hall.

If you would like to have a marriage ceremony in City Hall, you must come to the City Hall with a Justice of the Peace to perform the ceremony

Only marriage certificates are available to request by mail. Marriage licenses must be requested in-person. Marriage certificates are open to the public.

El Paso, TX 79913

Legal changes of name are only available in-person through New Haven’s Department of Vital Statistics and only if the individual was born in New Haven. In order to complete a legal change of name, you must do the following:

Bring in an affidavit (letter) stating that you are requesting that the Department of Vital Statistics change your birth name to the new legal name

Have the affidavit (letter) notarized

Provide the original document (with seal) from the court where your legal change of name was granted

Provide one of the acceptable forms of identification (ID):

Current State ID issued by DMV

Current motor vehicle ID issued by DMV (with the correct address)

A valid passport (copy of page with photo and expiration date listed)

Current Military ID

If you do not have any of these IDs, you will need any two of the following documents:

Social Security Card

Current utility bill showing name and address

Voter’s Registration Card

Car Registration showing your name and address

If you have any questions, please call 203-946-8263.

For individuals born outside of New Haven, contact the Vital Records Department of the Town where the birth occurred. For more information, see Requesting a Correction or Amendment to a Vital Record.
